section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the region, many filling stations sell fuel that has been customized to winter or summer conditions. Fuel that is available in winter, for instance helps make a cold start easier.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: For the best fuel efficiency, the gasoline should be sulfur-free or very low in sulfur content.
Fuels that are marked on the gas pump as containing metal must not be used.
Fuels with a maximum ethanol content of 25 %, i. e. E10 or E25, may be used for refueling.
The power and consumption specifications refer to operating with RON 98 E10 fuel
Fuel that conforms to the specification Brazil ANP xxx can be used in the national-market equipment for Brazil.
xxx: comply with the current valid Gasolina C standard in each case.
The engine is knock-controlled. Therefore, you can refuel with different recommended gasoline qualities.

When using minimum quality fuel like RON 91 or fuel with an ethanol content of more than 10% to max. 25%, knocking noises may occur and driving and acoustic performance may change. These have no effect on the engine service life.

section.title: Safety information

warning.paragraph: Caution

The use of poor-quality fuels may result in harmful engine deposits or damage. Additionally, problems relating to drivability, starting and stalling, especially under certain environmental conditions such as high ambient temperature and high altitude, may occur.

If drivability problems are encountered, we recommend switching to a high quality gasoline brand and a higher octane grade — AKI number — for a few tank fills. To avoid harmful engine deposits, it is highly recommended to purchase gasoline from Top Tier retailers.
Failure to comply with these recommendations may result in the need for additional maintenance.
NOTICE

Even small quantities of the wrong fuel or wrong fuel additives can damage the fuel system and engine. Furthermore, the catalytic converter is permanently damaged. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not refuel or add the following in the case of gasoline engines:

item.paragraph: Leaded gasoline.
Metallic additives, for instance manganese or iron.

warning.paragraph: Do not press the Start/Stop button after refueling with the wrong fuel. Contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

overview.overview-text: Do not refuel with gasoline that does not comply with the minimum quality

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Fuel that does not comply with the minimum quality can compromise engine function or cause engine damage. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not fill with fuel that does not comply with the minimum quality.

section.paragraph: Without ActiveFlex:

overview.overview-text: Do not use a refuel with a higher ethanol content

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Incorrect fuels can damage the fuel system and the engine. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not use fuels with a higher ethanol content than recommended. Do not refuel with fuels containing methanol, e.g. M5 to M100.

section.title: Recommended gas quality
section.paragraph: The engine is designed for gasoline as per DIN EN 228.
Premium-grade gasoline with 95 RON.
BMW recommends AKI 91.
Premium-grade gasoline with 95 RON or higher, which means 98 RON, is possible.
Use Premium gasoline (high-octane lead-free gasoline) above 95 octane (RON).

section.title: Minimum fuel grade
section.paragraph: Unleaded gasoline, 91 RON.
BMW recommends AKI 87.
If you use gasoline with this minimum AKI Rating, the engine may produce knocking sounds when starting at high external temperatures. This has no effect on the engine life.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The following diesel fuels can be refueled:

item.paragraph: Diesel fuels with a maximum biodiesel content of 10 %, for instance, B7 or B10.
Paraffinic diesel fuels, e.g., XTL.

warning.paragraph: NOTICE
Even small quantities of the wrong fuel or wrong fuel additives can damage the fuel system and engine. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage.
Follow the following for diesel engines:

item.paragraph: Use only Ultra-Low Sulfur Diesel.
Only refuel with biodiesel with a maximum of B5/5 % according to ASTM D975.
Do not use gasoline.
Note the minimum quality.
Refuel with sulfur-free fuels or fuels with the lowest possible sulfur content.
The vehicle manufacturer recommends only using diesel additives which have been classified as suitable.

warning.paragraph: Do not press the Start/Stop button after refueling with the wrong fuel. Contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Diesel fuel quality
section.paragraph: The engine is designed for diesel fuel as per DIN EN 590 and ASTM D975.
Use passenger car diesel fuel for diesel vehicles.
Diesel fuel with biodiesel fuel content of up to 7 % (B7).

section.title: Minimum fuel grade
section.paragraph: Diesel fuel with biodiesel fuel content of up to 10 % (B10).
Paraffinic diesel fuel as per EN15940.

section.title: Low-Sulfur Diesel
section.paragraph: The engine of your BMW is designed for diesel with low sulfur content:
Ultra-Low Sulfur Diesel ASTM D 975-xx.
xx: comply with the current standard in each case.
Use only Ultra-Low Sulfur Diesel.

The fraction of biodiesel in the fuel must not exceed 5 %, referred to as B5. Do not use gasoline. If you do fill the tank with the wrong fuel, for instance gasoline, do not start the engine as this may damage the engine.
In the case of incorrect refueling, contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop or Roadside Assistance.
If the fuel pump nozzle does not fit in the filler pipe of your BMW, please check to ensure that you are refueling at a diesel fuel pump that is equipped with a diesel fuel pump nozzle.

In the event the Ultra-Low Sulfur Diesel fuel cannot be fully inserted into the fuel filler neck, please contact BMW Roadside Assistance for instructions on how to add fuel. For more information on Roadside Assistance.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: BMW Advanced Diesel reduces nitrogen oxides in the diesel emissions by injecting the diesel exhaust fluid AdBlue into the exhaust pipe system. A chemical reaction takes place inside the catalytic converter that minimizes nitrogen oxides.

BMW Advanced Diesel reduces nitrogen oxides in the diesel emissions by injecting diesel exhaust fluid into the exhaust system. A chemical reaction takes place inside the catalytic converter that minimizes nitrogen oxides.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The vehicle has a tank that must be refilled.
To be able to establish the drive-ready state as usual, there must be an adequate amount of diesel exhaust fluid.
Diesel exhaust fluid can be refilled at any time.
Diesel exhaust fluid AdBlue is a registered brand of the Verband der Automobilindustrie e. V. (VDA) (German Association of the Automotive Industry).
Diesel exhaust fluid is available at many filling stations.
Preferably, refill diesel exhaust fluid using a fuel pump.

section.title: Displaying the fill level and top-up quantity
section.paragraph: The fill level and exact top-up quantity are shown on the control display.
A Check Control message is displayed when the fill level is low.

section.title: Reserve level indicator
section.paragraph: The reserve level indicator in the instrument cluster notifies you if there is a low fill level of diesel exhaust fluid in the tank.
Do not run down the tank for the diesel exhaust fluid until it is completely empty, as it will not be possible to restore the drive-ready state after switching off the engine.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: A yellow warning light is illuminated in the instrument cluster: fill level too low. The remaining range is displayed in the instrument cluster. Immediately add at least 5 liters5 liters, approx. 1.3 gal1.3 US gal/5 liters of diesel exhaust fluid.

Tank for diesel exhaust fluid is empty. Immediately add at least 15 liters15 liters, approx. 4 gal4 US gal/15 liters of diesel exhaust fluid. The engine will continue to run as long as it is not switched off and all other operating conditions are satisfied; sufficient fuel, for instance.

section.title: System malfunction
section.paragraph: A Check Control message is displayed when there is a system malfunction.
Visit the nearest authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

title.pcdata-case: Have the diesel exhaust fluid replenished

section.paragraph: BMW recommends that diesel exhaust fluid be added by the service center within the course of regular maintenance.
Provided you observe this maintenance schedule, it is normally necessary to replenish the fluid once between maintenance appointments.
The diesel exhaust fluid must be replenished as soon as the reserve level indicator appears in the instrument cluster to avoid not being able to reestablish the drive-ready state.

title.pcdata-case: Adding diesel exhaust fluid yourself in exceptional cases
Adding AdBlue yourself in exceptional cases

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: You can replenish Diesel exhaust fluid yourself in exceptional cases, for instance to get to your scheduled service.

overview-text.pcdata-case: Observe when handling diesel exhaust fluid

warning.paragraph: Warning

Small amounts of ammonia fumes can escape when opening the diesel exhaust fluid container. Ammonia fumes have a pungent odor and irritate skin, mucous membranes, and eyes. There is a risk of injury. Do not inhale escaping ammonia fumes. Avoid the contact of articles of clothing, skin or eyes with diesel exhaust fluid. Do not swallow any diesel exhaust fluid. Keep children away from diesel exhaust fluids.
Warning

Operating materials, for instance oils, greases, coolants, fuels, can contain harmful ingredients. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Follow the instructions on the containers. Avoid the contact of articles of clothing, skin or eyes with operating materials. Do not refill operating materials into different bottles. Store operating materials out of reach of children.
NOTICE
The diesel exhaust fluid ingredients are very aggressive. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Avoid contact of diesel exhaust fluid with surfaces of the vehicle.

section.paragraph: AdBlue as per ISO 22241-1

item.paragraph: Recommended: BMW Diesel Exhaust Fluid. With this bottle and its special adapter, diesel exhaust fluid can be replenished simply and safely.
Alternatively recommended: NOx Diesel exhaust fluid AUS 32.

section.paragraph: Diesel exhaust fluid can be purchased at an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Diesel exhaust fluid is available at many filling stations at a separate fuel pump. If possible, add diesel exhaust fluid using a fuel pump.

If no fuel pump is available, diesel exhaust fluid can be added using a container. Diesel exhaust fluid is available in different containers. Preferably, use the special bottle recommended by BMW. With this bottle and its special adapter, diesel exhaust fluid can be replenished simply and safely.

title.pcdata-case: Diesel exhaust fluid at low temperatures

section.paragraph: At outside temperatures below -11 ℃ -11 ℃/+12 ℉+12 ℉/-11 ℃, do not refill the diesel exhaust fluid until directly before the start of the trip.

section.title: Top-up quantity
section.paragraph: When the reserve level indicator starts, add with at least 5 liters5 liters, approx. 1.3 gal1.3 US gal/5 liters.

section.title: Displaying the top-up quantity
section.paragraph: The exact top-up quantity appears on the Control Display.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The fuel cap for diesel exhaust fluids is next to the fuel cap for the fuel tank.

section.title: Adding diesel exhaust fluid at the fuel pump
General information
section.paragraph: When refueling, hook the filler nozzle completely into the filler pipe. Lifting up the filler nozzle during refueling causes:

item.paragraph: Premature switching off.
Overflow of diesel exhaust fluid.

section.paragraph: The tank for the diesel exhaust fluid is full when the filler nozzle clicks off the first time.
When refueling, do not lift the filler nozzle. This may lead to an interruption of the fueling process.
Follow safety regulations posted at the filling station.

action-step.paragraph: Turn the fuel cap of the diesel exhaust fluid tank counterclockwise and remove.
Place the fuel cap in the bracket attached to the fuel filler flap.
Using the filler nozzle, add at least the recommended top-up quantity.
The fuel tank is full when the filler nozzle clicks off the first time.
Replace the fuel cap and turn it clockwise.
Press on the fuel filler flap until it engages.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: A Check Control message is displayed when an incorrect fluid is added.
In the case that an incorrect fluid was refilled, contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

warning.paragraph: Warning

After filling with an incorrect fluid, the system can heat and ignite. There is a risk of fire and an injury hazard. Only add fluids specified for the container. Do not start the engine after adding an incorrect fluid.

After adding an incorrect fluid, for instance antifreeze for washer fluid, the system can heat and ignite. There is a risk of fire and injuries. Do not add incorrect fluids. Do not start the engine after adding an incorrect fluid.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The reserve level indicator will still appear along with the remaining range after refilling.
The drive-ready state can be established.
After a short drive, the reserve level indicator goes out.
After filling, the indicator is still displayed.
The drive-ready state can only be established after the indicator turns off.

action-step.paragraph: Press the Start/Stop button three times.
The indicator goes out after approx. 1 minute.
Press the Start/Stop button and switch on the drive-ready state.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The engine oil consumption and engine oil properties depend on the driving style and operating conditions.
Therefore, regularly check the engine oil level after refueling by taking a detailed measurement.
The engine oil consumption can increase in the following situations, for instance:

item.paragraph: Sporty driving style.
Break-in of the engine.
Idle operation of the engine.
With use of engine oil types that are classified as not suitable.

section.paragraph: Different Check Control messages are shown on the control display depending on the engine oil level and engine oil properties.
The vehicle manufacturer recommends that you have an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop change the engine oil.

warning.paragraph: NOTICE
An engine oil level that is too low causes engine damage. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Immediately add engine oil.

overview.overview-text: Do not add too much engine oil

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Too much engine oil can damage the engine or the catalytic converter. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not add too much engine oil. When too much engine oil is added, have the engine oil level corrected by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
NOTICE

Engine oil that is not changed in timely fashion can cause increased engine wear and thus engine damage. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not exceed the service data indicated in the vehicle.

Engine oil that is not changed in timely fashion can cause increased engine wear and thus engine damage. There is a risk of damage to property. It is recommended that you do not exceed the service intervals indicated in the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The electronic oil measurement has two measuring principles:

item.paragraph: Monitoring.
Detailed measurement.

section.paragraph: When making frequent short-distance trips or using a sporty driving style, for instance when cornering aggressively, regularly perform a detailed measurement.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The engine oil level is monitored electronically while driving and can be shown on the Control Display.
If the engine oil level is outside its permissible operating range, a Check Control message is displayed.

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: A current measured value is available after approx. 30 minutes of normal driving.
A current measured value is available after approx. 30 minutes of normal driving with the combustion engine running.

section.title: Displaying the engine oil level
section.paragraph: The engine oil level is displayed.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: When making frequent short-distance trips or using a sporty driving style, it may not be possible to calculate a measured value. In this case, the measured value for the last, sufficiently long trip is displayed.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The engine oil level is checked when the vehicle is stationary and displayed via a scale.
If the engine oil level is outside its permissible operating range, a Check Control message is displayed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: During the measurement, the idle speed is increased somewhat.

item.paragraph: Vehicle is parked in a horizontal position.
The drive-ready state is switched on by pressing the Start/Stop button.
The engine is at operating temperature.
The combustion engine is at operating temperature.
Selector lever in selector lever position N or P and accelerator pedal not depressed.

section.title: Performing a detailed measurement
section.paragraph: The engine oil level is checked and displayed via a scale.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Only add engine oil when the message is displayed in the instrument cluster. The top-up quantity is indicated in the message shown on the Control Display.
Only add suitable types of engine oil.
Safely park the vehicle and switch off drive-ready state before adding engine oil.
Take care not to add too much engine oil.

warning.paragraph: Warning

Operating materials, for instance oils, greases, coolants, fuels, can contain harmful ingredients. There is a risk of injury or danger to life. Follow the instructions on the containers. Avoid the contact of articles of clothing, skin or eyes with operating materials. Do not refill operating materials into different bottles. Store operating materials out of reach of children.
NOTICE
An engine oil level that is too low causes engine damage. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Immediately add engine oil.

overview.overview-text: Do not add too much engine oil

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Too much engine oil can damage the engine or the catalytic converter. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not add too much engine oil. When too much engine oil is added, have the engine oil level corrected by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Overview
section.paragraph: The oil filler neck is located in the engine compartment.
Additional information:
For an overview.
For an overview.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The engine oil grade is critical for the service life of the engine.
Only add with the types of engine oil which are listed.
Some types of engine oils may not be available in all countries.

warning.paragraph: NOTICE
Oil additives can damage the engine. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not use oil additives.
NOTICE

Incorrect engine oil can cause malfunctions in the engine or damage it. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. When selecting an engine oil, make sure that the engine oil has the correct oil specification.

section.title: Suitable engine oil types
section.paragraph: Up to 1 liter1 liter, approx. 2 pints 1 US quart/liter of an engine oil with the following oil specification can be topped up:

section.title: Alternative engine oil types
section.paragraph: If approved engine oils are not available, up to 1 liter1 liter, approx. 2 pints of an engine oil with the following oil specification can be added:
If an engine oil suitable for continuous use is not available, up to 1 US quart/liter of an engine oil with the following oil rating can be added:

section.title: Viscosity grades
section.paragraph: When selecting an engine oil, make sure that the engine oil belongs to one of the following viscosity grades:
Viscosity grade SAE 0W-20 is not suitable for diesel engines.
Viscosity grades with a high viscosity degree can increase fuel consumption.
More information about suitable oil specifications and viscosity grades of engine oils can be requested from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

The manufacturer of the vehicle recommends that you ask an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop for more information on suitable oil specifications and viscosity classes.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Coolant consists of water and coolant additive.

Not all commercially available additives are suitable for the vehicle. The vehicle manufacturer recommends using coolant with the BMW LC-18 specification. Do not mix additives of different colors. Observe the water - additive mixture ratio of 50:50. Information about suitable additives is available from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The cooling system is maintenance-free.
Have coolant topped up by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

overview.overview-text: Only open the cooling system with the drivetrain cooled down

warning.paragraph: Warning
With the drivetrain hot and the cooling system open, coolant can escape and lead to scalding. There is a risk of injury. Only open the cooling system with the drivetrain cooled down.

overview.overview-text: Only open the cooling system with the engine cooled down

warning.paragraph: Warning
With the engine hot and the cooling system open, coolant can escape and lead to scalding. There is a risk of injury. Only open the cooling system with the engine cooled down.
Warning

Additives are harmful and incorrect additives can damage the drivetrain. There is a risk of injury and risk of damage to property. Do not allow additives to come into contact with skin, eyes or articles of clothing. Use suitable additives only.
Warning

Additives are harmful and incorrect additives can damage the engine. There is a risk of injury and risk of damage to property. Do not allow additives to come into contact with skin, eyes or articles of clothing. Use suitable additives only.

section.title: Coolant level
section.paragraph: A Check Control message is displayed when the coolant level is low.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The coolant may be overfilled in the coolant reservoir when the vehicle is delivered from the factory. The normal coolant level is achieved by operating the vehicle for a longer period.
The nominal coolant level is indicated by the maximum mark in the filler neck of the coolant reservoir.
Additional information:
For an overview.
For an overview.

action-step.paragraph: Allow the drivetrain to cool down.
Turn the lid of the coolant reservoir slightly counterclockwise to allow any excess pressure to dissipate, then open it.
The coolant level is correct when it is just below the maximum mark in the filler neck.
Turn the lid of the coolant reservoir slightly counterclockwise to allow any excess pressure to dissipate, then open it.
If the coolant is low, slowly add coolant up to the specified fill level; do not overfill.
Have the cause of the coolant loss eliminated as soon as possible.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Comply with the relevant environmental protection regulations when disposing of coolant and coolant additives.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: All spray nozzles are supplied from one tank.
Use a mixture of tap water, windshield washer fluid concentrate and, if required, antifreeze for the windshield washer system.
Use a mixture of tap water and windshield washer concentrate. If desired, a windshield washer concentrate containing antifreeze can be used.
Recommended minimum fill quantity: 2 liters2 liters, approx. 3.5 Imp. pints0.4 US gal/2 liters.
Recommended minimum fill quantity: 1 liter1 liter, approx. 1.7 Imp. pints0.2 US gal/1 liter.

overview.overview-text: Observe with antifreeze for washer fluid

warning.paragraph: Warning

Some types of antifreeze can contain harmful substances and are flammable. There is a risk of fire and an injury hazard. Follow the instructions on the containers. Keep antifreeze away from ignition sources. Do not refill operating materials into different bottles. Store operating materials out of reach of children.

United States: the washer fluid mixture ratio is regulated by the U.S. EPA and many individual states; do not exceed the allowable washer fluid dilution ratio limits that apply. Follow the usage instructions on the washer fluid container.
Use of BMW’s Windshield Washer Concentrate or the equivalent is recommended.

overview.overview-text: Observe when filling the washer fluid

warning.paragraph: Warning

Washer fluid can ignite and catch fire on contact with hot engine parts. There is a risk of injury or risk of damage to property. Only add washer fluid when the engine is cooled down. Next, fully close the lid of the washer fluid reservoir.
NOTICE

Silicon-containing additives in the washer fluid for the water-repelling effect on the windows can lead to damage to the washing system. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not add silicon-containing additives to the washer fluid.
NOTICE

Mixing different windshield washer fluid concentrates or antifreeze can damage the washer system. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Do not mix different windshield washer fluid concentrates or antifreeze. Follow the information and mixture ratios provided on the containers.

section.title: Overview
section.paragraph: The washer fluid reservoir is located under the hood.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The washer fluid reservoir is located in the engine compartment.
The washer fluid reservoir is located under the hood.
To open the container, press on the lower edge of the emblem on the hood. The lid opens when the vehicle is unlocked.

section.title: Malfunction
section.paragraph: The use of undiluted windshield washer fluid concentrate or alcohol-based antifreeze can lead to incorrect readings at temperatures below -15 ℃-15 ℃/+5 ℉+5 ℉/-15 ℃.
